Texture comment: some pieces show aligned open vesicles that indicate a flow texture; the rock is intensely fractured by hydrothermal processes but fractures are thin and individual 'clasts' can be still tied together
Phenocryst 1 comments: Probably fresh or only partially altered
Vesicle comments: Secondary minerals (anhydrite?) grow in the vesicles

Texture comment: some pieces show aligned open vesicles that indicate a flow texture; the rock is intensely fractured by hydrothermal processes but fractures are thin and individual 'clasts' can be still tied together
Phenocryst 1 comments: Probably fresh or only partially altered
Vesicle comments: Secondary minerals (anhydrite?) grow in the vesicles

Texture comment: Some pieces show plag pseudomorphs and open vesicles, partly coated with anhydrite? and pyrite; strongly altered with patches of variable alteration (allunite?); no primary minerals left, native sulfur is present
Vesicle comments: distinction between primary vesicles and secondary vugs diffcult

Texture comment: Some pieces show plag pseudomorphs and open vesicles, partly coated with anhydrite? and pyrite; strongly altered with patches of variable alteration (alunite?); no primary minerals left, native sulfur is present
Vesicle comments: probably secondary vugs rather than vesicles

Texture comment: hydrothermally completely overprinted, rich in disseminated pyrite, native sulfur, vugs and a cm-sized concretion-like feature at 105 cm
hydrothermally completely overprinted, rich in disseminated pyrite, native sulfur, vugs and a cm-sized concretion-like feature at 8 cm
hydrothermally completely overprinted, rich in disseminated pyrite, with native sulfur and vugs; lighter chemical reaction rims common along rims and fractures
Moderate to highly altered volcanic rock with gray to white hydrothermal haloes around rocks.
Groundmass comments: Fine-grained often include vugs and some pyrite crystals.

Texture comment: A hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock, rich in disseminated pyrite and crystals lined in some vugs; light gray to white alteration around the rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals.

A hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock, rich in pyrite-sulfate and crystals lined in some vugs; light gray minor alteration around some of the rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Preferred orientation of the elongated vugs. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals in the rock.

A hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock, rich in pyrite-sulfate and crystals lined in some vugs; light gray to pink minor alteration around some of the rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Preferred orientation of the elongated vugs. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals in the rock.

A hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock, rich in pyrite-sulfate and crystals lined in some vugs; light gray to pink minor alteration around some of the rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Preferred orientation of the round to elongated vugs. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals in the rock.

A hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock, rich in pyrite-sulfate with crystals lined in some vugs; light gray minor alteration around some fragments. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals in the rock.

A hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock, rich in pyrite-sulfate with crystals lined in some vugs; light gray minor alteration around some fragments. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals in the rock. Locally, there a few rounded clast-like shapes.

A hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals in the rock. Locally, there a few rounded clast-like shapes.

Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals. Locally, there a few rounded, darker shapes of unknown origin.
Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals. Alteration fronts parallel to veins.
Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals. Alteration fronts parallel to veins.

Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals. Alteration fronts parallel to veins. One dark clast at 80 cm
Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. many vugs with pyrite in the open spaces

Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Possible occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Veins with sulfate and sulfide minerals. Alteration fronts parallel to veins. Variable extend of alteration halos resulting in different shades of grey. A few clast-like features (color difference) but most likely only a result of alteration
Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Vugs filled with sulfate and sulfide minerals. Native sulfur present.
hydrothermally altered rock. Highly siliceous, almost chert-like; disseminated pyrite common; one piece resembles a hydrothermal breccia (4-13 cm); native sulfur present
hydrothermally altered rock. Highly siliceous, almost chert-like; disseminated pyrite common; piece resembles a hydrothermal breccia; native sulfur present
Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Vesicles? and vugs filled with sulfate and sulfide minerals. Native sulfur present.

Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Sulfate and sulfide minerals are common. Native sulfur is present. Two pieces are of lighter grey color and consist of silica, alunite?, sulfates and sulfides
Possible fall-in? Hydrothermally altered rock. Highly siliceous, almost chert-like with diss. pyrite and prob. allunite. Many small vugs filled with native sulfur.
Altered volcanic rock w/ plagioclase pseudomorphs filled by qtz? Resembles an altered and leached basalt. Individual pebbles are surrounded by light gray alteration halos.
Groundmass comments: Nature of groundmass not determinable. cryptocrystalline and altered
Phenocryst 1 comments: Possibly pseudomorphs rather than fresh crystals. Bimodal distribution of phenocrysts, some large ones but the majority are fine-grained thin laths. Also possibly altered. This texture is similar to the fresh dacite.

Texture comment: Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Diss. sulfide is abundant. Several alteration halos.

Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Occurrence of phenocryst pseudomorphs filled with secondary minerals. Diss. sulfide is abundant. Several alteration halos. Second piece is darker and probably more siliceous (fall in?)
Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Tabular blue sulfate minerals that may be pseudomorphs. Disseminated sulfide is abundant.
Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Light blue sulfate minerals that may be pseudomorphs. Veins with white alteration halo. Some contain small piece of clast with irregular shape.
Hydrothermally overprinted volcanic rock. Light blue sulfate minerals that may be pseudomorphs. Veins with white alteration halo. Irregular linear alteration pattern in some pieces.
Hydrothermally overprinted dark gray volcanic rock with alteration halo of light gray to white color.
